candidates.title: build: bump tokio from 1.24.2 to 1.25.0
candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.24.2 to 1.25.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.25.0

1.25.0 (January 28, 2023)

Fixed

  • rt: fix runtime metrics reporting (#5330)

Added

  • sync: add broadcast::Sender::len (#5343)

Changed

  • fs: increase maximum read buffer size to 2MiB (#5397)

#5330: tokio-rs/tokio#5330 #5343: tokio-rs/tokio#5343 #5397: tokio-rs/tokio#5397

candidates.title: build: bump termimad from 0.14.3 to 0.20.6
candidates.body:
Bumps [termimad](https://github.com/Canop/termimad) from 0.14.3 to 0.20.6.
Changelog

Sourced from termimad's changelog.

v0.20.6 - 2022-12-15

  • fix cases of selection becoming wider than content in input field

v0.20.5 - 2022-12-15

  • fix coolor version to prevent a dependency version problem with crossterm

v0.20.4 - 2022-12-03

  • reexport crossterm

v0.20.3 - 2022-09-20

  • fix some '' not being rendered because being incorrectly considered as escaping

v0.20.2 - 2022-06-07

  • update crossterm to 0.23.1 and coolor to 0.5

v0.20.1 - 2022-04-14

  • upgrade coolor to 0.4 (which is pure rust) to fix a cross-compilation problem

v0.20.0 - 2021-12-25

  • better algorithm for fitting tables, taking into account the whole column and not just its max width
  • some fitting functions which could panic on an assert in extrem cases now return a Result (there are unlikely to be used directly so this shouldn't lead to breaking changes)

v0.19.4 - 2021-12-22

  • fix a case of crash in input field

v0.19.3 - 2021-12-01

  • fix dimension of drawn Rect

v0.19.2 - 2021-11-28

  • better support of wide characters in InputField

v0.19.1 - 2021-11-26

  • update Crossterm to 0.22.1 to fix some bugs

v0.19.0 - 2021-11-15

  • addition of the small Rect utility, which lets you draw rects

v0.18.0 - 2021-11-11

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

candidates.title: chore(rust): show vault subcommand in cli help
candidates.body:
<!-- Thank you for sending a pull request :heart: -->

## Current Behavior
`vault` subcommand is hidden within help.

## Proposed Changes
show `vault` subcommand within help.

Fixes https://github.com/build-trust/ockam/issues/4097

<!-- Please describe the changes proposed in this pull request. -->
<!-- If this pull request resolves an already recorded bug or a feature request, please add a link to that issue. -->

## Checks

<!-- To help us review and merge this pull request quickly, please confirm the following:  -->

- [x] All commits in this Pull Request are [signed](https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits) and Verified by Github.
- [x] All commits in this Pull Request follow the Ockam [commit message convention](https://github.com/build-trust/.github/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I accept the Ockam Community [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/build-trust/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [x] I have accepted the Ockam [Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam-contributors/blob/main/CLA.md) by adding my Git/Github details in a row at the end of the [CONTRIBUTORS.csv](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam-contributors/blob/main/CONTRIBUTORS.csv) file in a separate pull request to the [build-trust/ockam-contributors](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam-contributors) repository.

<!-- Looking forward to merging your contribution!! -->

candidates.title: build: bump rustyline from 10.0.0 to 10.1.1
candidates.body:
Bumps [rustyline](https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline) from 10.0.0 to 10.1.1.
Release notes

Sourced from rustyline's releases.

10.1.1

Rollbacks incompatible changes relative to edition 2018 (#671) Full Changelog: https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline/compare/v10.1.0...v10.1.1

10.1.0

What's Changed

  • Upgrade nix dependency
  • Fix ViFirstPrint movement (#645)
  • Specify that Editor::iter ends at EOF (Fix #647)
  • Optim: do nothing on SIGWINCH if screen size doesn't impact current layout
  • Upgrade skim dependency

Full Changelog: https://github.com/kkawakam/rustyline/compare/v10.0.0...v10.1.0

Commits
  • 950d4e9 Prepare 10.1.1 release
  • 0dde217 Revert "Fix clippy warnings"

  • 402b5c5 Revert "Fix clippy warnings"
  • e717427 Revert "Upgrade nix dependency"

candidates.title: reduce `ockam_transport_uds` keywords
candidates.body:
To upload a crate to crates.io, we need the number of keywords to be < 5 else it fails
```bash
  the remote server responded with an error: invalid upload request: invalid length 8, expected at most 5 keywords per crate at line 1 column 1824
```
This PR reduces the number of keywords to 5

candidates.title: feat(rust): add influxdb lease show, create, revoke and list commands
candidates.body:
<!-- Thank you for sending a pull request :heart: -->

## Current Behavior
Currently no behavior to manage / interact with tokens within a token manager
<!-- Please describe the current behavior of the code before the changes in this pull request is applied. -->

## Proposed Changes

Adds show, create, revoke and list commands for influxdb token manager

Creates an Ockam Orchestrator API Client and Builder

Creates default project on enrollment, and uses that value within `ockam project authenticate` and `ockam lease` commands when `--project` is not supplied.

<!-- Please describe the changes proposed in this pull request. -->
<!-- If this pull request resolves an already recorded bug or a feature request, please add a link to that issue. -->

## Checks

<!-- To help us review and merge this pull request quickly, please confirm the following:  -->

- [x] All commits in this Pull Request are [signed](https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/managing-commit-signature-verification/signing-commits) and Verified by Github.
- [x] All commits in this Pull Request follow the Ockam [commit message convention](https://github.com/build-trust/.github/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I accept the Ockam Community [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/build-trust/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
- [x] I have accepted the Ockam [Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam-contributors/blob/main/CLA.md) by adding my Git/Github details in a row at the end of the [CONTRIBUTORS.csv](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam-contributors/blob/main/CONTRIBUTORS.csv) file in a separate pull request to the [build-trust/ockam-contributors](https://github.com/build-trust/ockam-contributors) repository.

<!-- Looking forward to merging your contribution!! -->

repo.name: ockam
repo.description: Orchestrate end-to-end encryption, cryptographic identities, mutual authentication, and authorization policies between distributed applications – at massive scale.

repo.description: Orchestrate end-to-end encryption, cryptographic identities, mutual authentication, and authorization policies between distributed applications – at massive scale.
